thig13.1:1.1: My hair was as black as bees,
thig13.1:1.3: now old, it has become like hemp bark—
thig13.1:1.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:2.2: my head was as fragrant as a perfume box;
thig13.1:2.3: now old, it smells like dog fur—
thig13.1:2.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:3.1: My hair was as thick as a well-planted forest,
thig13.1:3.2: it shone, parted with brush and pins;
thig13.1:3.3: now old, it’s patchy and sparse—
thig13.1:3.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:4.1: With plaits of black and ribbons of gold,
thig13.1:4.2: it was so pretty, adorned with braids;
thig13.1:4.3: now old, my head’s gone bald—
thig13.1:4.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:5.1: My eyebrows used to look so nice,
thig13.1:5.2: like crescents painted by an artist;
thig13.1:5.3: now old, they droop with wrinkles—
thig13.1:5.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:6.1: My eyes shone brilliant as gems,
thig13.1:6.3: ruined by age, they shine no more—
thig13.1:6.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:7.1: My nose was like a perfect peak,
thig13.1:7.2: lovely in my bloom of youth;
thig13.1:7.3: now old, it’s shriveled like a pepper;
thig13.1:7.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:8.3: now old, they droop with wrinkles—
thig13.1:8.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:9.1: My teeth used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:9.3: now old, they’re broken and yellow—
thig13.1:9.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:10.1: My singing was sweet as a cuckoo
thig13.1:10.3: now old, it’s patchy and croaking—
thig13.1:10.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:11.1: My neck used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:11.2: like a polished shell of conch;
thig13.1:11.3: now old, it’s bowed and bent—
thig13.1:11.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:12.1: My arms used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:12.3: now old, they droop like a trumpet-flower tree—
thig13.1:12.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:13.1: My hands used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:13.3: now old, they’re like red radishes—
thig13.1:13.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:14.1: My breasts used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:14.3: now they droop like water bags—
thig13.1:14.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:15.1: My body used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:15.2: like a polished slab of gold;
thig13.1:15.3: now it’s covered with fine wrinkles—
thig13.1:15.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:16.1: Both my thighs used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:16.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:17.1: My calves used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:17.3: now old, they’re like sesame sticks—
thig13.1:17.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:18.1: Both my feet used to be so pretty,
thig13.1:18.3: now old, they’re cracked and wrinkly—
thig13.1:18.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
thig13.1:19.1: This bag of bones once was such,
thig13.1:19.2: but now it’s withered, home to so much pain;
thig13.1:19.3: like a house in decay with plaster crumbling—
thig13.1:19.4: the word of the truthful one is confirmed.
